context.title: Area Format
context.description:
Use this dialog box to modify the appearance of the area that includes the axes and of the area within the axes (the plot area ).
You can change chart placement and padding, configure outlines, or add a shadow to the plot area.
Use the Hint parameters for height and width to place constraints on the calculated height and width of the chart area. Use the Inset parameters to adjust padding.
Note: Before you can configure an outline, you must make it visible. To do this, in the Plot page, select the Visible check box for the outline that you want.

context.title: Custom Properties
context.description:
Use this dialog box to define keys associated with your chart.
To add a key, type the key name in the text box below the list of keys and click Add.

context.title: General Properties
context.description:
Use this dialog box to set chart area properties.
The fields available in this dialog box change according to the type of chart you are defining. For three-dimensional charts and charts with depth, for example, you can define values for the "wall" and "floor" of the chart, and use the Series Depth setting to control how deep you want the chart to look.

context.title: Curve Fitting Line
context.description: Use this dialog box to format the style, width, and color of the curve fitting line for the chart, and also to define and format an optional label.

context.title: Labels
context.description:
Use this dialog box to define and format labels for the value-series elements in your chart.
In addition to selecting the data to be displayed in the labels, you can specify how the labels look. For example, you can position them inside or outside their associated chart element, change the font attributes (by clicking the button next to the Font field), and specify a background, outline, or additional padding (by defining insets).

context.title: Filters
context.description:
Use this dialog box to define filter expressions for selecting specific records to be included in your report.
For example, rather than display information about all customers, you can create filters to select customers in a certain region, or customers with a certain credit rank.
To make entries, click on a field. For Value 2, specify a value only if you selected the Between or Not Between operator.

context.title: Parameters
context.description:
Use this dialog box to define data set parameters to allow the user to filter report data.
If you bind a chart to a data set in which you defined parameters, it is possible to access those parameters by clicking Chart > Select Data .

context.title: Hyperlink Options
context.description:
Use this dialog box to link a chart to a web page, document, or image. You can also use it to link two reports, or two sections of a report.
If you are linking to an external report in HTML format, select a Target option. Target is equivalent to the HTML Target attribute. The options define where the linked document will open. For example, Blank opens the document in a new browser window. For more information about Target, see HTML documentation about this attribute.

context.title: Expression Builder - Specify Data Definition
context.description:
Use this dialog box to create expressions.
You can either type in the complete expression, or use the controls in the dialog box to guide you.

context.title: Externalize Text
context.description: Use this dialog box to externalize chart text elements. Externalizing text separates it from the chart in a file of its own and so makes localization easier.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Chart Area
context.description: Use this page to define the appearance of the area surrounding the chart, and to enable interactive linking for the chart area and the chart title.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Axis
context.description: Use this page to define the appearance of the chart axes.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Legend
context.description:
Use this page to define the title and the background color for the chart legend.
Note: The legend title will not be visible unless the legend is visible. To make the legend visible, you may have to click Layout, and then select Visible in the Layout Legend dialog box.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Plot
context.description:
Use this page to specify the background color for the area that is included within the axes and for the area that contains the axes. You can also choose whether to provide visible outlines for these areas.
For outline formatting options, click Client Area.
To specify the background color for the area outside the axes, use the Chart Area page.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Series
context.description:
Use this page to define the title and type of the series that are included in the graph.
Changing the "Color By" option changes which series is the basis for the color-coding in the chart. It also changes the legend to reflect the selected series.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: X-Axis
context.description:
Use this page to specify title, type, and position of the x-axis with respect to the y-axis.
For additional formatting options, click Scale, Text Format, Gridlines, and Markers.
Note that if you want the x-axis title to be displayed, you may have to click Text Format and select Visible.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Category (X) Series
context.description:
Use this page to format the "category" series (x axis) of the chart.
You can define how the category series data is sorted.
You can also enable and define grouping. To define grouping, do the following
1. For Type, to specify the type of data that the category series contains. You can also specify the units. 2. For Interval, select a number that represents the size of the groups to create. For example, to group three-row sequences of text data, select 3. To group numeric data in sections of four, select 4. 3. In Aggregate Expression, select the function to use to aggregate the data in the group: Average or Sum (that is, total).

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Y-Axis
context.description:
Use this page to specify title, type, and position of the y-axis with respect to the x-axis.
For additional formatting options, click Scale, Text Format, Gridlines, and Markers.
Note that if you want the x-axis title to be displayed, you may have to click Text Format and select Visible.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Value (Y) Series
context.description:
Use this page to format the properties of the "value" series (y axis) of the chart.
Note that you can select "Show Lines as Curves" to replace straight lines with curves, and "Show Curve Fitting Line" to retain the straight lines and display the curves in addition.
Use the Labels, Interactivity, Curve Fitting Line, and Series Palette buttons to further refine the formatting of the value series.

context.title: Edit Format
context.description: Use this dialog box to define a format for the selected Data Type.

context.title: Gridlines
context.description: Use this dialog box to display or hide the selected axis line and gridlines that run parallel to the axis. Use it also to customize their appearance.

context.title: Interactivity
context.description:
Use this dialog box to define interactive features of your chart, both the types of interactivity and the actions that trigger the interactive responses.
If you change a definition, click Update to apply it.

context.title: Layout Legend
context.description:
Use this page to define the legend for the chart.
You must select Visible before you can enter a title.
For additional formatting options, click Text Format and Layout.
Note: If the legend is not displayed, click Layout and select Visible.

context.title: Markers
context.description:
Use this dialog box to create axis markers, define marker position and other marker properties, and define marker label properties. Markers can be single lines or ranges, and call attention to a specific location on the axis.
Select a marker in the text box to work with its definition.
You can you can access additional formatting options by clicking the buttons to the right of the Value and Font fields.

context.title: New Data Set
context.description: Use this dialog box to define a data set for graphing.

context.title: Outline
context.description:
Use this dialog box to indicate whether you want to frame the chart with a visible outline, and to specify the properties of the outline.
Specify insets to adjust the padding between chart and outline.
The default unit for specifying insets is points. To change the default units, from the New Chart of Edit Chart dialog box, click Format Chart, then Chart Area, then General Properties.

context.title: Scale
context.description:
Use this dialog box to set the minimum and maximum values displayed on a numerical axis.
For both numerical and non-numerical axes, you can set the number of minor, or secondary, gridlines displayed for each unit on the axis.
Note: If the minor gridlines are not displayed, click Gridlines, then select Visible for Minor Grid.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Select Data Set
context.description:
Use this page to select a data set, or click Create New to open the New Data Set dialog box.
Bind columns of data to the chart by dragging the column head to the appropriate field.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Select Chart Type
context.description:
Use this page to specify the type of chart you want.
All chart types can be fine-tuned using this page. Some have subtypes, some can be displayed in three dimensions, or can be displayed as "deep" charts (charts with a three-dimensional appearance, but conveying no additional information in the third dimension). Some charts permit you to add another axis.
You can also specify the output format for the chart.
Note: If you select an output format that your system does not support, you will not be able to open the Select Data page.
Click Finish to save your selections.

context.title: Series Palette
context.description: Use this dialog box to select colors for members of the series. Double-click a bar to display the options.

context.title: Edit Font
context.description:
Use this dialog box to format the font for a text item. When you change an font option, the change is displayed in the Preview text box.
You can set the orientation of the text item either by dragging the Rotation dial or by specifying degrees.

context.title: Text Format
context.description:
Use this dialog box to customize text format.
This dialog box is used to format text for many graph elements. The fields that are available for input depend on the element that you are working with.

context.title: Title Format
context.description:
Use this dialog box to format the title area and the title text.
You can define outlines for both title and title area, and also specify inset values to increase the blank space around the element.
If you want to change the title font, click ... next to Format.

context.title: Preferences: Chart
context.description: Use this page to enable or disable interactive chart previews as you modify the chart definition. Use it also to set the maximum number of rows in the chart data preview on the Select Data page of the chart builder.
